Text:
Highway 37 is reported to be underwater within our lifetimes.

Climate action can't wait, & my GREEN Act is going to be the largest investment in climate action that our country has ever seen. We must continue to press for these investments and stop the effects of climate change.

Every student in #CA05 and across the country deserve to have a welcoming and well-funded public school to pursue their education.

During #PublicSchoolsWeek, I am committed to investing in our students, teachers, and schools to provide a bright future to all. https://t.co/Y88kIyzrGp

Heads up, @CountyofSonoma: An overnight cold weather warning has been issued starting tonight through Friday morning.

A warming center is open in Santa Rosa at 610 Wilson Street and will run between 8pm and 7am. Donations can be dropped off between 8 and 10 tonight & tomorrow. https://t.co/CPxmj7sm7R

I am LIVE with @AsmAguiarCurry for a virtual town hall. Tune in to hear about the most pressing issues our communities are facing.

Listen in on Twitter Spaces!

https://t.co/IVJr3kJKUe

The #ChildTaxCredit is available to families even if they received monthly CTC payments in 2021.

Make sure to file your 2021 federal income tax return to ensure that you receive the 2nd half of these payments.

TONIGHT AT 6 PM PT: Join me and @AsmAguiarCurry for a virtual town hall to discuss the issues that are a priority for our district.

Make sure to RSVP by emailing thompson.townhall@mail.house.gov or listen in on our Twitter Space: https://t.co/IVJr3kJKUe

The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act is going to save families money, reduce commute times, improve lives with access to internet and clean water, and connect our communities.

These investments were long overdue, and I am proud to have voted to pass this law.
It is important to work together with our NATO allies and Ukraine to protect democracy, defend territorial integrity, and ensure peace wins out. 2/2

The move by Russia this weekend to recognize Donetsk and Luhansk as “independent” from Ukraine is nothing more than a thinly veiled attempt to cover up Putin’s blatant disregard for Ukraine’s sovereignty. 1/2

TOMORROW AT 6 PM: I’m going live on Zoom with @AsmAguiarCurry to answers your questions and hear about the issues that matter to our communities.

To join, RSVP to thompson.townhall@mail.house.gov or you can watch live on my Facebook page. https://t.co/oomQ5PMw12

Today is the start of Sonoma County Restaurant Week! Our local restaurants are the backbone of our economy and this week, we can recognize their tremendous service and contributions.
 
What are your favorite local restaurants in Sonoma County?
Happy Presidents’ Day! I hope everyone has a wonderful day honoring and celebrating our presidents who served our country. https://t.co/b8cPUgpbef

The vaccine is the most effective tool we have to combat #COVID19 – and it’s both safe and free.
 
Find an appointment near you today and do your part to protect our communities: https://t.co/mUK1zrNBEE

Across #CA05, countless people depend on Social Security payments to make ends meet.
 
Americans pay into Social Security their entire lives and deserve to  retire with dignity. I’m proud to work with @RepJohnLarson to expand benefits and improve this program for years to come.

Incredible news! Santa Rosa’s inRESPONSE Mental Health Support Team is now officially responding to calls! These professionals will provide support to those in crisis.
 
Emergency number: 707-575-HELP (4357)
 
General number: 707-204-9756
 
Email: inRESPONSE@srcity.org

Driving on roads that need repairs costs families thousands of dollars every year from wear and tear on their cars.
 
The investments in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law will repair these roads and bridges which will reduce unnecessary repairs and help families save money.

We must #SaveThePostOffice to ensure that their critical responsibilities can continue without delay.
 
The Senate must take up the Postal Service Reform Act and protect the longevity of the postal service for years to come.

#CA05 RESIDENTS: On Tuesday at 6 PM, I’m holding a town hall with @AsmAguiarCurry to discuss and answer your questions regarding the issues that are most important to you and our community.

Don’t miss out and RSVP today: thompson.townhall@mail.house.gov https://t.co/kvWlPbMDAC

HEADS UP: Cal Fire will be conducting 10-acre prescribed burns in the Jenner Headlands starting this morning and will run through Monday.
 
Firefighters will be monitoring the burns and will remain on scene overnight to ensure there are no problems. https://t.co/Xokh95Vit5

Solving our housing issues creates a ripple effect. Access to housing drives economic growth, helps students perform better, & improves health outcomes.

I’m joining @WeAreGenH for a webinar on the State of Housing in Sonoma County on 2/24. Register here: https://t.co/t6xKpAmo8S

It was great to meet @BLMca’s new State Director, Karen Mouritsen, and Deputy State Director, Erica St. Michael, and discuss the bureau’s upcoming priorities. I look forward to working with you to protect and preserve our public lands. https://t.co/NiPVujLizY

It’s always a good day when I get to spend time with my longtime friend Madelene Lyon.

We caught up on Lake County history, agriculture, growing walnuts and grapes, and more.  Thank you, Madelene, for your fierce advocacy for Lake County! https://t.co/fAlgWbz6PP

Today, I was glad to attend the groundbreaking of the Napa Valley Transportation Authority and Vine Transit Maintenance Facility.
 
Public transit connects our communities, and this project will create jobs and boost our economy. I look forward to seeing it completed! https://t.co/hUOvJUS1wT

It was great to see the new Lake County Elections building & meet with Lake County Registrar Maria Valdez & her amazing team — they do an outstanding job.

Voting is the most important tool in our democracy — learn more about how to register to vote here: https://t.co/jFNsTvSoPt https://t.co/RN07qhQ9Ui

The Child Tax Credit cut childhood poverty to historic lows and provided families with the money they need to buy groceries and gas and cover rent and utilities.

We must renew this program and provide a bright future to every child.
https://t.co/Bv0ItvE5LG

Today marks 80 years since FDR signed EO 9066 which wrongfully imprisoned over 120,000 Japanese Americans.

On this Day of Remembrance, we remember these atrocities and work to ensure that hateful rhetoric that demonizes different communities is confronted wherever it persists.

This week, I met with @CMAdocs to discuss the ongoing effects of COVID-19 on healthcare workers, the expansion of telehealth & healthcare priorities in the Build Back Better Act. I will continue to work to ensure our healthcare workers receive the resources & support they need. https://t.co/h53MoHc8n0

REMINDER: The indoor mask mandate has now been lifted for vaccinated individuals in Lake, Napa, Sonoma, Solano, and Contra Costa counties. 
 
There are situations where a mask is required so read this helpful article from @NorthBayNews about what to know!
https://t.co/cwVpqEbqWi

The investments in the bipartisan infrastructure law are going to cut commute times by fixing our roads and improving public transit in #CA05.
 
It’s simple — these investments are going to make life easier for families across our district.

Investing in child care is investing in our future.
 
By providing access to high-quality child care, we can get many parents back to work & boost our economy. These investments will set up our children for a bright future — I’m ready to make child care accessible to all.

The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act is sending tens of billions to California to fix our roads and pave a brighter future.

This funding could benefit projects like the Lake County Pavement Preservation Project to repair and restore 50 miles of roads in Lake County.

Climate change is the most pressing issue that our communities currently face.
 
This is a yet another troubling warning that we must act on. It’s time to pass historic legislation to combat climate change and stop the threat it poses to our world.
 
https://t.co/bET9hnfVwq

Vallejo has a proud history with the U.S. Navy and the former shipyard at Mare Island.
 
It was great to meet the new Executive Director of the Vallejo Naval & Historical Museum Melinda McCrary, tour the museum, and learn about her plans to teach about our storied past. https://t.co/0R2Y2KJu3j

Napa County could receive key funding from the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act to repair bridges across the county.

That includes bridges like the Chiles Pope Valley Road bridge, the Greenwood Avenue over Garnett Creek bridge, and the Dry Creek Road bridge. https://t.co/QQA5U6H6XO

Today, I had the honor to recognize @RichFreedmanVTH with a Congressional Record Statement in celebration of his long and storied career with the @vjotimesherald. 

Rich provided a voice to our communities, and I wish him the best of luck in retirement. https://t.co/BTD9O65NA8

In the wealthiest country on earth, no one should go bankrupt paying for health care or prescription drugs.

We must move forward legislation that cuts costs of prescription drugs, insulin, and more to make health care more accessible to every American.

Reliable, affordable, high-speed internet is key to learn, work, and participate in the economy.

The Affordable Connectivity Program is a $14.2 billion program from the bipartisan infrastructure law to give low-income households a $30 per month discount. https://t.co/y3gDXQorHq https://t.co/n426wN1mgz

The plan released by Insurance Commissioner Lara is a promising framework to lower insurance costs & protect our homes.

As our communities continue to face threats of wildfire, home-hardening can reduce premiums & the risk of being dropped by providers. 
https://t.co/FMxOkdC5zY

Always great to see more bike paths completed throughout #CA05. 

I worked to pass the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act to invest in projects like the Vine Trail to connect our communities and provide safe recreation activities to all.
https://t.co/SAspFLpHaH

While no amount of money can bring back those who lost their lives in the Sandy Hook shooting, this is a step towards accountability.

I am thinking of the Sandy Hook community today and will continue to work towards preventing further mass shootings.

https://t.co/fjgNVNxtmm

Great news! @SantaRosaHealth is receiving nearly $2 million to advance telehealth care in Sonoma County. 

Telehealth has been important during the pandemic & I am proud to continue to support organizations that provide quality & accessible care to #CA05.

https://t.co/8IuCSHQZsO

We will hear from experts about the status and impact of the bipartisan infrastructure law and how the tax code can expand economic investment in our infrastructure. 2/2
https://t.co/yyy0mYd3ee
TODAY @ 2PM: I am holding a @WaysMeansCmte Select Revenue Measures Subcommittee hearing on the economic benefits of investing in our infrastructure. 1/2

It was great to meet with local labor leaders yesterday to discuss how we’re working to ensure that workers are centered in our recovery efforts.

Thank you for talking with me about your priorities and for the questions about how we’re going to build a stronger economy for all. https://t.co/QWLgS2ZKXW

The GOP has starved the IRS of key funding by cutting their budget by billions & blaming IRS management for a decline in service.

I am working with my Democratic colleagues to ensure the IRS has the resources it needs to promptly gets tax refunds into the hands of Americans. 2/2

Recent reports show that nearly 24 million taxpayers haven’t had last year’s returns processed by the IRS.

That is especially unacceptable as we enter tax season again. 1/2

But their strength and resilience in the face of such a heartbreaking day was inspiring.

This tragedy spurred a youth-led movement, @AMarch4OurLives, to stand up against gun violence and work towards a safer and more secure future for all.

Four years ago today, 17 lives were lost at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in #Parkland. My thoughts are with the community and the survivors of this devastating attack.

Every student, teacher, staff, parent, sibling, and community member is now a gun violence survivor. https://t.co/GPQigB6BSI
Happy Valentine’s Day to my forever Valentine. https://t.co/ZEL6jQYKGv

Today, I sent a letter to @SecDebHaaland calling for the protection of migratory birds through the enforcement of the Migratory Bird Treaty Act.
 
This will ensure that companies that incidentally kill migratory birds through accidents like oil spills will be held accountable. https://t.co/qvdcqZ5X4N

Great news! The US Fish and Wildlife Service announced $1.5 billion in grants to wildlife agencies to support fish restoration programs across the country.
 
As a proud fisherman, I know that conservation is vital to protect & restore these populations for generations to come.

STARTING FEB. 16: Indoor mask mandates will be lifted for VACCINATED people in Contra Costa, Napa, Solano & Sonoma counties.
 
We must stay vigilant against COVID-19, and if you haven’t yet received the vaccine, get yours today to help keep our communities safe.

Climate change is the most pressing issue that our communities face, and it’s going to take a joint effort at the local, state, and federal level to combat it.
 
I applaud these efforts by Napa City Council to tackle climate change and reduce emissions.
https://t.co/dsEzFGJ0u0

Great job, Sonoma County! An 80 percent vaccination rate is an amazing achievement, let’s keep it up.
 
The vaccine is the best way to protect our communities from #COVID19 — find an appointment near you at https://t.co/mUK1zrNBEE.
https://t.co/SYAy18MC0R

Throughout #CA05, our roads and highways are ready for investment.
 
Roads like Highway 37, Highway 12, and I-80 are critical to connect our communities and I am proud that the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act is going to send key funding to CA for projects like these.

This week, I sat down with the @MuseumSoCo to hear about their current and upcoming programs at the museum.
 
I am so grateful for their work preserving and displaying our history, and I look forward to seeing all the incredible exhibits that showcase our community. https://t.co/rI1MA10Dwe

My bill, #HR172, would reauthorize the US Anti-Doping Agency and ensure that we have strong anti-doping rules to protect athletes and minors who may be pressured to use substances to get an unfair advantage. 

A strong anti-doping system prevents that culture from taking hold.

This is a disgusting & horrendous advertisement from a man seeking to represent the people of Arizona in the United States Senate.

Gun violence is not a political prop — I strongly condemn this advertisement and call for it to be taken down immediately.

https://t.co/8eLO8sXfcE

Great to gather in front of Technology High School in Rohnert Park to present a Congressional Record Statement honoring the National Blue Ribbon award the school received in 2021.
 
I was proud to recognize their work of overall academic excellence. https://t.co/LY0s7y6O5X

It was great to meet with California State University Engineering Deans to discuss campus priorities throughout California state universities & what Congress is doing to continue supporting higher education. Thank you for your work to help our students succeed and thrive. https://t.co/czW0KcWPlD

The overwhelming majority of responsible gun owners support critical gun violence prevention measures like universal background checks & red flag laws.

That’s because they know that these measures will save lives while protecting our 2nd Amendment rights.
https://t.co/SkT2u2ya5S

Electric vehicles play a key role in combating climate change & investing in EV charging infrastructure will help reduce carbon pollution across the US.
 
I’m proud that CA will receive over $56M from the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law to expand this infrastructure & create jobs. https://t.co/SrPqN9YRXk

It was great to meet with some constituents from #CA05 to discuss what we can do on the individual level to combat climate change and answer their insightful questions. Thank you for your advocacy on this important issue! https://t.co/atPfB2rjie

The #ChildTaxCredit slashed child poverty & helped families in #CA05 put food on the table, fill the gas tank, and keep a roof over their heads.

If you received CTC payments in 2021, you could receive the 2nd half in your tax returns. Visit https://t.co/x5oplPp4pD to learn more.

Clean electricity tax incentives will shift our energy use towards renewable energy, shrink our carbon footprint, and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

My GREEN Act is the largest investment in climate action ever, and I’m ready to see it signed into law.
https://t.co/MDK4bhWCeQ

Keeping our communities safe means keeping illegal guns out of the hands of dangerous people.

I wrote a letter to @USMayors calling for strong local provisions to ban ghost guns — I applaud this effort by mayors across the country to stop crime and save lives. https://t.co/5vTTzG6Gzm

Today, I had the immense privilege to honor Art Ibleto, the Pasta King, by passing legislation that renames the Cotati Post Office to the Arturo L. Ibleto Post Office.
 
He left an unforgettable mark on our communities, and I was proud to call him a friend. https://t.co/cSK1qoNLOU

Great meeting with Jeff Parr, David James, and Clay Cook from @NALC_National to discuss the Postal Service Reform Act, how we can improve service, and ensure the longevity of the Postal Service. https://t.co/sdznZWz3zW

As we continue to work on legislation in Congress, these are some of my top priorities to deliver for the people of #CA05. It’s time we step up and deliver substantive change to make life easier for every American. 2/2

Right now, I am working to set up our families for a bright future by lowering the cost of prescriptions drugs and insulin, transitioning our country to clean energy with my GREEN Act, and creating jobs here in the United States. 1/2

The Postal Service plays an essential role to deliver prescriptions, paychecks, local news, and more to our communities, both rural and urban. 

Today, I will be voting for the Postal Service Reform Act to protect the postal service for years to come and increase transparency.

Today, I am remembering the 900,000 Americans who have lost their lives to #COVID19.
 
My thoughts are going out to all those who have lost a loved one to this virus — know that I am committed to doing everything in my power to keep our communities safe and healthy. https://t.co/88F4X8ugPq

The 2021-22 school year has experienced more shootings than at any point in the last decade.

What does it say that we teach students active shooter drills but don’t do more to keep guns away from dangerous people?

https://t.co/4YBOIpfB9b

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act I voted for is going to ensure that critical chips are produced here by strengthening domestic manufacturing & prioritizing US workers.

That means creating good-paying American jobs, addressing supply chain challenges, and lowering costs for families.

Protecting our democracy includes ensuring that the January 6 insurrection can never happen again.

We cannot let those who perpetrated this assault on our representative government get away with it.

As we close the 4th annual National Gun Violence Survivors Week, we must recognize the trauma that gun violence survivors experience for the rest of their lives.

We have to take action now to stop the cycle of violence and keep our communities safe. #GVSurvivorsWeek https://t.co/c0Er0h7zW4

Here’s a few things that Democrats are prioritizing:
 
✅ Protecting our democracy
✅ Making it easier to vote
✅ Keeping our communities safe from gun violence
✅ Lowering the cost of prescription drugs
✅ Getting people back to work
✅ Building a bright future for every family

The only way we’re going to get through this pandemic is by wearing a mask, getting the vaccine, and getting a booster if you’re eligible.
 
These efforts don’t just protect you; they protect your family and friends. We can do this!
https://t.co/Kl9hK2fnkk

Thanks to Democrats and @POTUS, 2021 saw:
📈 Greatest 12 months of job creation in our nation’s history
📉 Largest drop in the unemployment rate on record
👶 Largest reduction in childhood poverty in a single year
💵 Strongest economic growth in 40 years

Over the last year, we have seen child poverty slashed to the lowest levels on record thanks to the #ChildTaxCredit that I passed last year.
 
Renewing this program is the first step to ensuring that every child has the support they need to live a healthy & successful life.

Today marks the 29th anniversary of the Family and Medical Leave Act.
 
I worked with my @WaysMeansCmte to advance legislation that would provide universal paid leave, and I am committed to ensuring that no worker has to choose between their health, family, and their paycheck.
RT if you’re ready to end gun violence. #GVSurvivorsWeek

The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act is the largest investment in our infrastructure since Eisenhower’s federal interstate system.

After 4 years of talk from the previous administration, @POTUS delivered infrastructure for the United States.

As @HouseGVP Chair, I applaud @POTUS' ongoing efforts to reduce gun violence in our communities.

By supporting law enforcement, stopping the flow of ghost guns, keeping firearms away from dangerous people & investing in community-based intervention programs, we can save lives.

Today, I proudly cast my vote to restore American leadership in manufacturing and invest in American workers. 

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act will bolster our economy by preventing shortages of critical goods and ensuring they're made right here in the US.

https://t.co/KuZwnJel4j

This month’s jobs report adding 467,000 jobs shows that Democrats are getting people back to work.
 
I’m committed to making sure that we continue to bring good-paying jobs back to the US and that we are providing economic opportunity to every American.

https://t.co/c6wec3oz9T

Today, my staff & I celebrated the anniversary of my longest serving staffer, Brad Onorato.
 
For 32 years, Brad has worked harder than anyone, has been a bulldog for #CA05, and a dear friend. He loves our district and the work as much, and I'm so honored to have him on my team. https://t.co/uGLGQrjrhP

Declining American manufacturing has reduced economic opportunity for working families. The #AmericaCOMPETES Act would bring high-quality jobs back to the U.S., invest in cutting-edge research & bolster American competitiveness. It's time to #BuyAmerican. https://t.co/uqzXVHsVDo

On the 152nd anniversary of the 15th Amendment which protected the right to vote against racial discrimination, I call on the Senate to pass voting rights legislation to protect our most sacred right.
 
It’s past due to ensure our democracy is fair & accessible to every American.

Every one of these kids is a gun violence survivor, from Marjory Stoneman Douglas to Sandy Hook to Columbine. 

This week, we must uplift and support gun violence survivors and work to prevent gun violence in our schools and communities. #GVSurvivorsWeek 2/2

Since the Columbine school shooting, more than 292,000 children have been exposed to gun violence at school.

An entire generation of students are learning that active shooter drills are a regular part of going to school — a grim reality. #GVSurvivorsWeek 1/2

Met with @AfterTheFireUSA to discuss what Congress can do to create income tax exemptions to support wildfire survivors. 

Thank you for your advocacy on this important issue & I'll continue to work to ensure wildfire survivors have the resources they need to recover and rebuild. https://t.co/w5gTJrE1ot

Great to see a former member of my Student Leadership Council recognized as the first Napa County Youth Poet Laureate.

Congratulations to Joey DeNatale on this honor — I look forward to seeing all that you accomplish in a bright future.

https://t.co/foiG4Hlh89

Today is World Wetlands Day, and as a proud member of the Migratory Bird Conservation Commission and hunter for the last 60 years, I am committed to preserving these critical ecosystems and providing opportunities for responsible recreational activities like hunting. https://t.co/nTg84jh7zJ

Today, @POTUS, @VP, and @FLOTUS are taking action to end cancer as we know it.
 
We're setting an ambitious goal to reduce the cancer death rate by at least 50% over the next 25 years. It's time to improve the experience of people and their families living with cancer.

Telehealth has been shown to provide immense benefits to health outcomes by providing easier access to health care for underserved communities.

I’m proud to be working to ensure that everyone in #CA05 can receive the care they deserve.

https://t.co/bDMXz8esyC

HAPPENING NOW: My colleagues and I on the @WaysMeansCmte are holding a hearing on expanding access to mental health resources to ensure that everyone struggling has the support they need. You can tune in below. https://t.co/SU7q0GwMbx

Unemployment is down 71 percent since @POTUS took office and inflation continues to slow.

Democrats are getting people back on the job, working to lower prices, and building a stronger and more inclusive economy for every American.

The Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act is the largest investment in our infrastructure since Eisenhower’s highway system.

Want to learn more about this historic law? Visit https://t.co/j2YD09sl1l to explore funding opportunities from this law and how to apply.

Today, we must continue to support all survivors of gun violence and help them deal with the impact that persists even years after the initial trauma. #GVSurvivorsWeek 

7/7

Gun violence like this touches everyone. Every first responder, everyone at Pathway Home, and everyone throughout our community. 

6/7

Thankfully, I was told that my son was safe. Later that day, we found out that three women were killed. Christine, Jen, and Jennifer were taken from their families too soon while they were at their place of work supporting veterans as they returned to the United States.

5/7

On the way, I was briefed by former Napa Sheriff John Robertson and learned that a deputy had exchanged gunfire with the suspect.

4/7

I was supposed to be heading to Sacramento for a gun violence prevention town hall but instead I drove straight to Pathway Home where my son, a Napa Deputy Sheriff, was among the first to respond.

3/7

Almost 4 years ago, I was flying back to California and upon landing, I was told that a gunman had taken hostages at the Yountville Veterans Home.

2/7

During National Gun Violence Survivors Week, I am thinking of the friends and families of Christine Loeber, Jen Golick, and Jennifer Gonzales Shushereba. #GVSurvivorsWeek 

🧵THREAD 1/7 https://t.co/NKvIkX6XiH
Happy Lunar New Year! I am wishing all those who celebrate a peaceful, prosperous, and successful year ahead. #YearOfTheTiger https://t.co/UoD8txggej

Today marks the beginning of #BlackHistoryMonth! As we celebrate and honor the history and contributions of African Americans in our country, we must recommit to protecting and preserving the principles of equality, liberty, justice and for all.

This week, my thoughts are with the survivors of gun violence as we continue to push for reforms that will reduce gun violence, keep our communities safe, and prevent dangerous people from getting guns. #GVSurvivorsWeek 2/2

As the Omicron variants surges, restaurants are struggling to keep their doors open, leading to temporary closures & loss of revenue.

This is sad news, I am praying for a swift recovery for all those injured in this bridge collapse.

Our waterways are interconnected.
 
When we invest in our ports, harbors, and waterways, we grow our economy, create jobs, and ensure clean water for healthy children, families, and communities.

SONOMA COUNTY: Four weekends of free COVID-19 vaccines are coming up at the Sonoma County Fairgrounds!

Clinics will be held Saturday and Sunday for each of the next four weekends, Jan. 29-30 and Feb. 5-6, 12-13, and 19-20 from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m.  
https://t.co/BYsk72YEpx

I’m proud to welcome my office’s newest @BrookingsInst Fellows, Craig Kiley and Jerrod Kearney! Craig comes to us from @NGA_GEOINT and Jerrod comes from @NSAGov

Once again, it's time for New Year's Resolutions! This year, my resolution is to continue working with my colleagues to pass the #BuildBackBetter Act and work to make sure criminals and the dangerously mentally ill don't get their hands on guns. What's your resolution for 2022?
